sub_title: 𝐌𝐒𝐜 𝐒𝐩𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐚𝐥 𝐄𝐧𝐠𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐞𝐫𝐢𝐧𝐠 at University of Twente | 𝐂𝐨𝐧𝐬𝐮𝐥𝐭𝐚𝐧𝐭 at BlackEarth
summary:
Hello, I'm Azza. I'm a graduate student at the University of Twente, studying Spatial Engineering and also a consultant at BlackEarth. I'm focused on using technology like GIS, Remote Sensing, and machine learning to create solutions for retail, FMCG, finance and banking industries. My research explores using geospatial tech for things like improving disaster response and vehicle routing.

Before my current study, I worked in product management, using methods like Agile and Lean Startup. This gave me a strong understanding of solving user problems with technology. With over 6 years of diverse experience, including teaching and editorial roles, I bring a unique perspective. I'm excited to connect with others who are interested in technology's role in building a safer world.

More on: https://linktr.ee/asawungrana

projects.title: Make Simple Titan Civilization Map
projects.description: Like Earth, Titan has tens-of-thousands-of-year variations in climate driven by orbital motions," Aharonson says. "On Titan, there are long-term climate cycles in the global movement of methane that make lakes and carve lake basins." "We may have found an example of present-day climate change, analogous to Milankovitch climate cycles on Earth, on another object in the solar system," he adds.

projects.title: NUKE MAP APPLICATION AND GIS TECHNOLOGY INTEGRATION TO DETERMINE EVACUATION TRACK POST NUCLEAR BOMBING IN JAKARTA
projects.description: This world is so close to nuclear warfare on the Cold War era. There are so many nuclear weapons produced and it’s easy to use them to make a new world war. Because of that Indonesia has to prepare to face every possibility. Jakarta is Indonesia’s capital with main activities that makes it as one of nuclear attack target because if we attack Jakarta, Indonesia will be paralyzed. Integration of Geographical Information System, Nukemap application, and literature review used to make the result. Nukemap is an application to predict damage of nuclear bomb. This study is important for countermeasures after disaster with decide the effective evacuation location near Jakarta. The result of this study is nuclear bomb disaster countermeasures modeling that are in the form of evacuation location mapping and safest destination location for ease evacuation process.

projects.title: Placement Estimation of Sea Wave Energy Electricity Source at Karst Shores Region in Gunungkidul Regency, Yogyakarta
projects.description: Ratio of fossil energy use and clean energy use in Indonesia is 65.5:8.5 with 187.32 million cubic ton carbon emission on 2010. Indonesia is an archipelago country that has great wave energy potential to produce electricity. Sea wave, an eco-energy source can produce about 20-70 kWh/m. South Java shores are a kind of shore that have great potential  sea wave energy  especially at Gunungkidul district that its region characteristics formed by karst/limestone. This research has a purpose to determine the area suitability for onshore sea wave energy power station through GIS, spatial land analysis, and weighting method. Area suitability level is grouped to suitable (S1), suitable conditional (S2), and not suitable (N). Weighting method uses this following parameter: shore morphology, sea depth, shore tilt, wave type, wind velocity, and wind direction as early appraisal for area suitability identification to place onshore sea wave power station in Gunungkidul Regency.

contributors.headline: 𝐌𝐒𝐜 𝐒𝐩𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐚𝐥 𝐄𝐧𝐠𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐞𝐫𝐢𝐧𝐠 at University of Twente | 𝐂𝐨𝐧𝐬𝐮𝐥𝐭𝐚𝐧𝐭 at BlackEarth

profile_positions.description:
As the founder and lead consultant at BlackEarth, I leverage my extensive knowledge of geospatial technology and product management to provide tailored solutions for businesses and individuals.

At BlackEarth, we specialize in merging the power of Geographic Information Science (GIS), Remote Sensing, and machine learning to create innovative solutions for everyday problems. We focus on areas such as site selection, outlet monitoring, supply chain optimization, and disaster risk reduction. Our work spans the sectors of retail, mainly Small-Medium Enterprises (SMEs) in Food & Beverage (F&B), and Fast-Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG), ensuring these industries make the most of geospatial technology.

At BlackEarth, we don't just offer technology; we offer solutions. We take the time to understand our clients' unique challenges, and we craft bespoke solutions that make a tangible difference. Whether you're a business wanting to optimize your supply chain, or an individual trying to make better location-based decisions, BlackEarth is committed to helping you leverage the power of geospatial technology.
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description: As an administrator of a geospatial writing platform, I am managing and maintaining the website and its content. This includes tasks such as moderating user-generated content, enforcing community guidelines, and ensuring that the website remains up-to-date and functional.
profile_positions.title: Administrator

profile_positions.description:
As the lead product manager for LOKASI Intelligence, I oversee the management of our suite of products, including the main Lokasi Intelligence platform, a web-based location intelligence application that helps Indonesian enterprises expand and manage their businesses. The Data and Account Panel is a tool that manages account accessibility and bridges data, reducing synchronization time for our clients. The Mobile Companion App, an Android-based app, assists clients in choosing the right location to expand on the field and serves as a data gathering tool for the main app.

Notable achievements in my role include the launch of the second main version of our platform in April 2021, which significantly improved the user experience, the implementation of agile methodologies tailored to our team's needs and resources, the establishment of a strong and autonomous SDLC process, the creation of a better DevOps environment to optimize teamwork, the success of our clients in expanding their businesses despite the pandemic, and the streamlining of the requirement gathering, research, concepting, and prototyping process to increase team efficiency. In addition to these achievements, my main responsibilities include market research, product and business strategy, product development, product design, and product ownership.
profile_positions.title: Lead Product Manager

profile_positions.description: As a product specialist at LOKASI Intelligence, I was responsible for managing the development of the first version of our main platform, which included setting team pace and workload for client requests, managing the roadmap and timeline, establishing product strategy and market justification, and gathering client requirements. To improve team efficiency, I implemented an agile framework and developed product requirement document standards to be used as the main reference for developing features. My main tasks included managing the development of LOKASI Intelligence based on client requests and setting up product strategy and market justification.
profile_positions.title: Product Specialist

profile_positions.description: I was responsible for managing the spatial data and mapping components of the project, including working with the survey teams to design and implement a comprehensive data collection plan. I also coordinated with other specialists and stakeholders to ensure that all necessary data was collected and analyzed accurately.
profile_positions.title: GIS Specialist

profile_positions.description:
1. Developed and launched sustainability-focused tourism products that promote the conservation of natural resources and support the local community in Indonesia.
2. Conducted research on sustainable tourism practices, including the empowerment of local communities and the protection of natural environments.
3. Created and managed digital content, including promotional videos, photographs, and website content, to support the marketing and operations of the company.
profile_positions.title: Head of Product

company.name: Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs of the Republic of Indonesia

profile_positions.company: Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs of the Republic of Indonesia
profile_positions.description:
1. Produced and compiled thematic maps, including permission, strategic, and natural resource maps, for the Coordinating Ministry of Economic Affairs in Indonesia.
2. Integrated thematic maps into an Indonesian typographic map as the base layer.
3. Coordinated the synchronization of permission maps (mining permits, cultivation rights, location permissions) with relevant regions and ministries.
4. Conducted geospatial analysis to identify trends and patterns in data related to natural resources and permissions.
5. Utilized geospatial software, such as GIS or mapping platforms, to create and maintain maps and datasets.
6. Participated in the development and implementation of policies and strategies related to geospatial data management and mapping.
7. Collaborated with cross-functional teams to gather and integrate data from various sources and stakeholders.
8. Provided technical support and training to colleagues and partners on the use of geospatial tools and techniques.
profile_positions.title: Geospatial Data Analyst

profile_positions.description:
My duty as the science and technology cluster coordinator of the Study Club Communication Forum (SCCF) at Universitas Gadjah Mada (UGM):
1. Planning and organizing events related to science and technology: coordinating with guest speakers, securing venues, and promoting the events to the community.
2. Leading a team of volunteers: As the coordinator, I was responsible for overseeing the work of other volunteers who were helping to plan and execute events.
3. Collaborating with other organizations and departments: I worked with other student groups or academic departments to plan joint events or to share resources.
4. Promoting the SCCF and its events: I was responsible for promoting the SCCF and its events to the UGM community, including through social media and other channels.
5. Providing support and guidance to members: As the coordinator, I acted as a mentor or coach to other members of the SCCF, helping them to develop their skills and interests in science and technology.
profile_positions.title: Science and Technology Cluster Coordinator

profile_positions.description: As the Remote Sensing for Geomorphology, Geology, and Soil Science Laboratory Assistant at UGM, my responsibilities include educating and training individuals on the practical applications of remote sensing techniques and methods in the fields of geomorphology, geology, and soil science. This includes demonstrating the use of remote sensing tools and technologies, such as satellite imagery and aerial photography, to analyze and interpret earth surface features and processes, as well as providing guidance and support on the implementation of remote sensing techniques in research and field projects.
profile_positions.title: Remote Sensing for Geomorphology, Geology, and Soil Science Laboratory Assistant

profile_positions.description: As the Disaster Mapping Laboratory Assistant at UGM, my responsibilities include educating and training individuals on the use of Geographic Information System (GIS) and remote sensing techniques for disaster mapping and management. This includes demonstrating the use of GIS software and tools to analyze and represent a wide variety of data types, such as vector and raster data, in the context of disaster mapping and preparedness. In addition, I also provide guidance and support on the implementation of GIS and remote sensing techniques in disaster response and recovery efforts and collaborate with researchers and faculty on various projects and initiatives related to disaster mapping and management, particularly in the context of frequent disasters in Indonesia.
profile_positions.title: Disaster Mapping Laboratory Assistant

profile_positions.description: As the Remote Sensing of Non-Photographic System Laboratory Assistant at UGM, my responsibilities include educating and training individuals on the use of non-visible light as a source for remote sensing of the Earth's surface. This includes demonstrating the principles and applications of remote sensing using non-visible electromagnetic waves, such as radar and thermal imagery, and how these can be used to acquire information about the Earth's surface and its features. I also provide guidance and support on the implementation of non-photographic remote sensing techniques in research and field projects and collaborate with researchers and faculty on various projects and initiatives related to the use of non-visible electromagnetic waves in remote sensing.
profile_positions.title: Remote Sensing of Non-Photographic System Laboratory Assistant

profile_positions.description: Teach about English for daily and business conversations for high school students and adults in my hometown as there are many people that lack of English. I also teach written English for academic and general purposes. This experience allows me to speak English more fluently as I spoke to native almost everyday at that period. I also learn much how English should be taught.
profile_positions.title: English Teacher

volunteer_experiences.description: Gadjah Mada Mengajar is a voluntary education organization. This organization is the embodiment of empathy and duty of Universitas Gadjah Mada's students as agent of changes. The core of Gadjah Mada Mengajar itself is similar to what Indonesia Mengajar possesses. We taught children of left-behind villages around Yogyakarta to strive with education. My personal duty is to create fun and fine curricula for students with only 3 meetings per week. But as other student volunteering programs, we all struggled in human resources that lacked of motivation and also budget for development. But nevertheless, we strive to provide our best for the children.

Assisting Indonesian Army to handle refugees following the Merapi Volcano 2010 eruption which affected my town. I had the job to assist them on delivering food and water to the families of refugees for several days. This was happened in my second year of high-school. And this was also the reason of why then I pay much attention to volunteering and social work.

Social work in South East Molucca. A final duty for Universitas Gadjah Mada students is to perform social work with our personal studies around Indonesia. I personally helped for village mapping, which at that time had been a huge feud between villages in South East Molucca. With my village mapping, it helped them to define their territory borders.
